alert.note: Alert for Central Black Hills; Northern Black Hills (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS RapidCity (Western South Dakota and Northeastern Wyoming)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued April 06 at 6:40AM MDT until April 07 at 12:00AM MDT by NWS RapidCity
info.description: .Snow will continue through most of the day. The heaviest snow is expected in the morning into early afternoon, with a gradual decrease in snow into the evening. Accumulations at lower elevations will generally be in the 1 to 3 inch range, with over 6 inches at higher elevations. The snow combined with wind gusts over 50 mph will lead to blowing and drifting snow, especially in open areas, and could result in significant travel impacts. ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT MDT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations 1 to 3 inches at lower elevations, and over 6 inches at higher elevations. Little snow will fall in the Mount Rushmore and Rockerville areas. Winds will gust as high as 60 mph. * WHERE...In South Dakota, the Central Black Hills and the Northern Black Hills. In Wyoming, the Wyoming Black Hills. * WHEN...Until midnight MDT tonight. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Strong winds could cause tree damage.
info.instruction: A Winter Storm Warning for snow means severe winter weather conditions are expected. This will create dangerous conditions. Road conditions are available on your smartphone from the 5 1 1 app for your state.

area.areaDesc: Central Black Hills; Northern Black Hills
